column4: you mean you can not connect to outside sites or others can not connect your servers?
others can't connect to my server
what kind of server is it?
for example ftp server forwarding is not that simple
try http server first
or even better ssh first
I'm running ubuntu 7.10 server with a 3rd party ftp and a teamspeak server
does ssh connections to your box from outside work?
no
so your box can ping your router?
and itables rules are all ALLOW?
even better do /etc/init.d/iptables stop to be sure
you mean your server has an ip that should be directly accessible from internet?
yes
can you reach your router ip from internet?
ping
no I mean can you ping your router ip from outside your network
Talking to yourself now?
But, yes! I can't be sure whether it is the modem/router or the server responding.
I am, however, using a no-ip hostname to connect.
sorry maybe it is a language problem :)
but I am little confused
could be
your router should have WAN ip different from your server ip
Well... it hasn't
I know it's strange, but that's the way it is
My router is by all purposes NO WAN ip and is inaccessible from outside this LAN
I don't think the router is routing anything as long as the server is concerned other when connecting from this computer
you can connect internet behind your NAT-ed network right?
then it is routing
I can connect from this computer which has LAN ip, and I can download with the server from http (to get packages or something)
to clarify once more your - the machine you are sitting right now - what ip it gives when you do ifconfig
I'm sitting on my gaming computer running vista and has ip: 10.0.0.1
and that vista machine is connected directly to router?
yes
what ip you get when you access whatismyipaddress.com from vista machine
the same ip which the server has
and you have no proxies active?
no
so somehow your server and router are sharing the same ip?
In a way yes. However, this worked beautifully when running XP with ftp and ts server
but as I stated earlier that could be upnp
the problem is that I do not understand how your network works ant all :)
wait a moment :)
mayge I got you wrong - your server machine - what it shows when you ifconfig it?
is it the same address that you get when you whatismyipaddress.com from your server machine and your local machine?
yes
actually I am curious now, how can it be possible that two boxes have the same WAN ip address?
they don't? ;)
Actually, I think you just solved my problem!
well if you say that your server box is connected to your router and has the same ip as your router has?

& andi6: I think it may have to do with the fact that my router is using upnp and the server using the routers WAN ip. Upon connecting from this computer to the server, could it be that the router redirects incoming connections to this computer and not the server?
yeah but I do not understand how your server machine can access internet from
if it has only external ip address?
I would like to know about that technology that makes that happen, sounds interesting :)
hehehe
WAP?
sorry scratch that :p
I meant does it show WIFI interface addresses
and yes it does
I guess so, but my server doesn't have wireless
btw when you use your server machine browsing internet and when you use different browsers - firefox, opera and try whatismyipaddress.com then you get the same external ip always?
maybe there is still some kind of proxy
it's a server install... no GUI
damn it :)
you just told me that whatismyipaddress.com gave you from the server machine the same address as your vista machine did?
yes
well if your server machine does not have GUI how can you tell?
what browser you used to access internet then from the server machine?
I'm sorry! I misread the question
I check www.whatsmyip.org from this computer and ifconfig on server
ok I ask then once again - what ip you get when you access internet (world wide web) from your server machine directly
I mean you go physically to your server box, use some kind of textual browser and give the result you get when you put in the address whatismyipaddress.com
I'm unsure how.
or you can use ssh to log to your server machine and give the result using some textual browser :)
and btw... can't I use ssh?
now we are getting somewhere
you mean you do not know if you can access internet from your server machine :)
I can... I've used wget
ok
ssh into your server machine
I've been logged on the whole time
so what you get when you lynx from server machine :)
but be back, your problem looks interesting
so let me know about the lynx results :)
How do I use lynx? lynx www.whatsmyip.org ?
I installed lynx... runing it now
great
and it is the same address as your vista and router have?
yes
I am currently reading about bridges :)
because I have no idea how your internet works :p
